TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicant was appointed as an inspector at ORG of ORG . In DATE he was transferred to ORG ( the ORG internal structure had been altered in DATE ) . At that time he had the rank of major . His duties included counterintelligence , the recruitment and managing of secret agents , the gathering and dissemination of information from secret sources , secret surveillance , etc .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE a proposal was made for the applicant ’s disciplinary dismissal . The proposal was prompted by an internal investigation which found indications that the applicant had engaged , aside from his duties at the Ministry , in fish farming , and that he had sought to resolve disputes with the persons employed by him by threatening them with his position . It was felt that these activities were incompatible with the duties of an officer of ORG and tarnished the reputation of the service .
CARDINAL . The proposal was not upheld due to the lack of sufficient evidence .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Director of ORG sent a letter to the head of ORG ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) . He referred in detail to the above facts and suggested that the applicant be subjected to psychological assessment on the basis of Instruction no . ICARDINAL ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Director of ORG ordered the applicant to present himself for assessment at ORG .
CARDINAL . The applicant underwent a psychological assessment on DATE . It consisted of a psychological test , an interview and a polygraph test .

CARDINAL . NORP The results of the assessment were available on DATE . The psychologist who had carried it out described the results of his observations and of the polygraph test , and expressed the opinion that the applicant was mentally unfit to work at ORG . The document was classified and the applicant was not allowed to see it .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Director of ORG proposed to the Minister of ORG to dismiss the applicant from his post under section CARDINAL(CARDINAL)(CARDINAL ) of ORG DATE and regulation CARDINAL(CARDINAL)(CARDINAL ) of the Act ’s implementing regulations ( see paragraphs CARDINAL and CARDINAL below ) . In his proposal he described in detail the attempt to dismiss the applicant on disciplinary grounds and the results of the psychological assessment . The applicant was allowed to have sight of the proposal the same day .
CARDINAL . In an order of DATE the Minister of ORG dismissed the applicant by reference to the legal provisions mentioned in the proposal .
CARDINAL . The applicant was acquainted with the order on CARDINAL DATE and noted his disagreement with the grounds for issuing it .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant sought judicial review of the Minister ’s order . He argued , inter alia , that it had not been duly reasoned and that the psychological assessment on the basis of which it had been issued had not been objective .

CARDINAL . In the course of the proceedings before ORG presented a copy of the applicant ’s psychological assessment . The proceedings as a whole were then classified , apparently because the case file contained a classified document .

CARDINAL . The applicant was initially represented by CARDINAL lawyers . The first of them withdrew from the proceedings because he could not obtain the requisite security clearance to be able to have access to the documents in the case file . The second also withdrew because she did not have enough legal experience to be granted rights of audience before ORG . The applicant accordingly retained another counsel who had the requisite experience and security clearance .

CARDINAL . In her written pleadings counsel for ORG submitted , inter alia , that after the applicant had been found mentally unfit for work , under section CARDINAL(CARDINAL)(CARDINAL ) of ORG ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) , the Minister had been bound to dismiss him from his post .

CARDINAL . A threemember panel of ORG heard the case on DATE . Counsel for the applicant argued , inter alia , that the psychological assessment had not been correctly carried out and that its results could not be trusted . Counsel for ORG argued , inter alia , that the assessment could not be subjected to judicial scrutiny .

CARDINAL . In a judgment of DATE ( реш. № CARDINAL от CARDINAL октомври DATE г. по адм. д. № СCARDINAL/CARDINAL г. , ORG , V о. ) , the threemember panel rejected the applicant ’s claim , finding that no breaches of the rules of procedure had occurred in the course of the dismissal procedure . It went on to say that it was not competent to review the results of the psychological assessment carried out by ORG . Under the terms of regulation CARDINAL(CARDINAL)(CARDINAL ) of the implementing regulations of ORG ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) , such assessments amounted to incontrovertible proof of unfitness for work at ORG , and ORG was the only body competent to determine that issue . The panel also found no indication that the dismissal order was not in line with the purpose of the law .

CARDINAL . The applicant appealed on points of law . He challenged , inter alia , the psychological assessment procedure and the independence of the experts who had carried it out . He also contested the threemember panel ’s ruling that ORG was the only body competent to carry out such an examination and that the court could not scrutinise the correctness of the ORG ’s opinion . In an additional memorial filed on DATE he pointed out that in a judgment of CARDINAL DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) another panel of ORG had stated that the assessment of mental fitness for work at the ORG should be amenable to judicial scrutiny .

CARDINAL . In a final judgment of CARDINAL DATE ( реш. № CARDINAL от CARDINAL май DATE г. по адм. д. № СCARDINAL/CARDINAL г. , PERSON , петчл. св ) , a fivemember panel of ORG dismissed the appeal . It held , inter alia , that the psychological assessment procedure had been duly followed , and that the threemember panel had been correct to find that it could not scrutinise the assessment . Its judgment had been given before the judgment of DATE which had partly struck down regulation CARDINAL ) of the implementing regulations of ORG DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) and had been based on the wording of that regulation in force before the judgment of DATE .

CARDINAL . As the proceedings were classified , the applicant could not obtain copies of ORG judgments . On DATE he asked the court to issue certificates containing the ORG operative provisions and indications as to the subject matter of the case . The president of the fivemember panel which had dealt with the case acceded to the request , and on DATE the applicant was issued CARDINAL certificates , CARDINAL in relation to the threemember panel ’s judgment and another in relation to the fivemember panel ’s judgment .
CARDINAL . In the meantime , on DATE the applicant requested the reopening of the proceedings .
CARDINAL . In a judgment of DATE ( реш. № ORG от CARDINAL април DATE г. по адм. д. № СCARDINAL/CARDINAL г. , PERSON , петчл. св ) ORG rejected the request .

CARDINAL . On DATE a commission appointed by the president of ORG declassified the TIME of the hearings before the threemember and fivemember panels , as well as their judgments . It did so by reference to regulation CARDINAL ) of the Regulations for the implementation of ORG , which provides that the level of classification must be changed if it has been set incorrectly .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the LAW of DATE provides :
“ CARDINAL . The courts shall review the lawfulness of the administration ’s acts and decisions .
CARDINAL . Natural and juristic persons shall have the right to seek judicial review of any administrative act or decision which affects them , save as expressly specified by statute . ”

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of ORG ( “ the DATE LAW ) , in force until DATE , provided that the ORG ’s activities were subject to “ civic control [ exercised ] through the authorities set out in the LAW and LAW ” .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL)(CARDINAL ) of the Act provided that civil servants employed by ORG were to be dismissed from their posts if they were unfit to carry out their duties . Section CARDINAL ) provided that unfitness of work within the meaning of section CARDINAL(CARDINAL)(CARDINAL ) was to be established in the manner laid down in the Act ’s implementing regulations . The dismissal order was subject to judicial review ( section CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . Regulation CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of the Act ’s implementing regulations , which came into force in DATE and were repealed in DATE , specified that unfitness within the meaning of section CARDINAL(CARDINAL)(CARDINAL ) of the LAW could result from : ( a ) a final conviction and effective sentence of imprisonment ; ( b ) the inability to carry out one ’s duties effectively , as established by an internal audit ; ( c ) the systematic or repeated commission of disciplinary offences which were not of a level of gravity warranting disciplinary dismissal ; ( d ) a failure to complete the initial professional qualification course ; ( e ) a failure to submit a conflict - of - interest declaration or an incompatibility established on the basis of such a declaration ; ( f ) mental unfitness for work at the ORG , as established by ORG ( regulation CARDINAL(CARDINAL)(CARDINAL ) ) ; and ( g ) a court order preventing the person concerned from holding certain types of employment as a punishment in a criminal case .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Minister of ORG issued Instruction no . ICARDINAL on “ the psychological selection and psychological aspects of the appraisal ( reselection ) of the civil servants ( officers , sergeants and civilian staff ) employed by the Ministry ” . The instruction was issued under , inter alia , regulation CARDINAL of the CARDINAL Act ’s implementing regulations , which provided that the mental and physical fitness of the ORG ’s staff was to be assessed periodically in a manner laid down by the Minister ( this regulation was repealed in DATE ) . Section CARDINAL of the ORG provided that those assessments were to be carried out by ORG ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) . By virtue of section CARDINAL , the purpose of the psychological assessment of the ORG ’s staff was to determine ( a ) their current mental condition , ( b ) diminished motivation , behavioural or emotional inadequacy , or general deadaption leading to low professional effectiveness , or ( c ) abuse of position for financial gain . In carrying out the assessment of staff suspected of abusing their posts , the ORG ’s experts could resort to a polygraph test ( section CARDINAL(CARDINAL)(a ) ) . Such persons could be subjected to sporadic assessments with a view to protecting the ORG from “ staff members who ha[d ] lost their mental or emotional stability or other professional qualities and [ could ] cause damage to themselves , the [ Ministry ] or society through actions or omissions ” ( section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) ) . The conclusion of the assessment could be “ mentally fit for the post ” , “ mentally unfit for the post ” or “ mentally unfit for work at ORG ” ( section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) ) . The results of the assessment could , inter alia , constitute grounds for dismissal under section CARDINAL(CARDINAL)(CARDINAL ) of the CARDINAL Act and regulation CARDINAL(CARDINAL)(CARDINAL ) of the Act ’s implementing regulations ( section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) ) . The conclusion that a person was “ mentally unfit for work at ORG ” was final and not subject to review ( section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) ) .

CARDINAL . The Ministry ’s Psychology Institute was set up by the Government in DATE for the purpose of carrying out initial and followup psychological examinations of the staff of ORG , drawing up psychological expert reports , and training the ORG ’s staff ( point CARDINAL of Decree no . CARDINAL of DATE of ORG ) . At the relevant time its structure and activities were governed by Regulations no . ICARDINAL issued by the Minister of ORG on DATE ( in DATE they were superseded by Regulations no . GPE ) . Its director was appointed and dismissed by the Minister .

CARDINAL . In its early caselaw under section CARDINAL(CARDINAL)(CARDINAL ) of the LAW and regulation ORG ) , ORG consistently held that the ORG ’s assessment of a person ’s mental fitness for work at ORG was not subject to judicial review and could not be contested through any means , and that a conclusion that a person was mentally unfit for work at ORG required the Minister to dismiss that person ( see реш. № CARDINAL от CARDINAL януари DATE г. по адм. д. № DATE г. , PERSON , петчл. св ; реш. № CARDINAL от DATE г. по адм. д. № GPE DATE г. , ORG , V о. ; реш. № CARDINAL от CARDINAL март DATE г. по адм. д. № ORG г. , ORG , V о. ; реш. № DATE от CARDINAL декември DATE г. по адм. д. № DATE г. , PERSON , V о. ; реш. № DATE от CARDINAL февруари DATE г. по адм. д. № CARDINAL/CARDINAL г. , ORG , V о. ; реш. № CARDINAL от CARDINAL май DATE г. по адм. д. № DATE г. , ORG , V о. ; and реш. № CARDINAL от CARDINAL юни DATE г. по адм. д. № DATE г. , ORG , V о. ) .

CARDINAL . In DATE several persons brought a legal challenge to regulation CARDINAL(CARDINAL)(CARDINAL ) ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) . In a judgment of DATE , which came into force on DATE following its publication in ORG ( реш. № CARDINAL от CARDINAL февруари DATE г. по адм. д. № CARDINAL/CARDINAL г. , PERSON , петчл. св , обн. , GPE , бр. CARDINAL от CARDINAL февруари DATE г. ) , a fivemember panel of ORG partly upheld the challenge and decided to strike out the wording “ established by the [ ORG ] Psychology Institute ” . It noted , inter alia , that the ORG was directly subordinate to the Minister , and that its assessments of a person ’s mental fitness for work at ORG were not subject to any form of review . There was therefore no guarantee that in carrying out those assessments the ORG ’s experts would not commit errors , abuse their powers or deprive those concerned of their rights . That was important because if the ORG ’s experts assessed a member of staff to be mentally unfit for work at ORG , the Minister had no discretion and was bound to dismiss him or her . Although the member of staff concerned could seek judicial review of the Minister ’s order , such a challenge would be futile because the assessment , which formed the basis of the Minister ’s order , was not amenable to judicial scrutiny . The court acknowledged that the employment of the ORG ’s staff touched upon national security . Nonetheless , it went on to hold that considerations relating to national security had to yield to a person ’s right under LAW ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) to judicial review of all administrative decisions affecting his or her rights . The court said that the assessment of a person ’s mental fitness for work at ORG should be amenable to “ the same control for lawfulness , [ namely ] by several independent experts and by the court , as in the case of assessing health conditions [ for the purpose of granting disability benefits ] ” . Therefore , in as much as it provided that ORG was the only body authorised to assess mental fitness for work at ORG , regulation CARDINAL(CARDINAL)(CARDINAL ) ran counter to section DATE CARDINAL Act ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) and LAW . It was in addition contrary to the purpose of the law .

CARDINAL . Following the delivery of that judgment , a panel of ORG held that , as a result of the partial strikedown of regulation CARDINAL(CARDINAL)(CARDINAL ) , the ORG ’s assessments could , even if predating the strike - down , be subjected to judicial scrutiny in proceedings for judicial review of a dismissal order ( see реш. № CARDINAL от CARDINAL април DATE г. по адм. д. № CARDINAL г. , PERSON , V о. ) .

CARDINAL . However , other panels of the court abided by the old caselaw , holding that the lawfulness of dismissals which preceded the entry into force of the judgment of CARDINAL DATE was to be judged by reference to the wording of regulation CARDINAL(CARDINAL)(CARDINAL ) before its partial strikedown because the strikedown did not have retroactive effect ( see реш. № CARDINAL от DATE г. по адм. д. № С-CARDINAL/CARDINAL г. , PERSON , петчл. св ; реш. № CARDINAL от QUANTITY DATE г. по адм. д. № DATE г. , PERSON , ORG ; реш. № CARDINAL от CARDINAL януари DATE г. по адм. д. № DATE г. , PERSON , V о. ; реш. № DATE от CARDINAL май DATE г. по адм. д. № DATE г. , PERSON , ORG ; № ЯCARDINAL от CARDINAL януари DATE г. по адм. д. № CARDINAL г. , PERSON , V о. ; and № ЯCARDINAL от CARDINAL февруари DATE г. по адм. д. № DATE г. , PERSON , петчл. св ) . In CARDINAL judgment a panel stated that the effect of that judgment had been to make it possible to challenge the ORG ’s psychological assessment in cases where the dismissal had taken place after the judgment ( see реш. № CARDINAL от CARDINAL юни DATE г. по адм. д. № CARDINAL/CARDINAL г. , PERSON , V о. ) .

CARDINAL . A panel of the court also held that the order that a member of staff should submit to a psychological assessment was merely a preparatory act and was not itself amenable to judicial review ( see реш. № DATE от CARDINAL юни DATE г. по адм. д. № DATE г. , PERSON , V о. ) .

CARDINAL . In a number of judgments given between DATE and DATE panels of the court found that the psychological assessment procedure had been used to circumvent the rules governing disciplinary liability , and on that basis quashed the dismissal orders ( see реш. № DATE от DATE г. по адм. д. № DATE г. , PERSON , V о. ; № DATE от DATE г. по адм. д. № DATE г. , ORG , V о. ; № DATE от DATE г. по адм. д. № DATE г. , ORG , V о. ; № CARDINAL от DATE г. по адм. д. № DATE г. , ORG , V о. ; реш. № DATE от CARDINAL ноември DATE г. по адм. д. № CARDINAL г. , PERSON , V о. ; реш. № CARDINAL от CARDINAL февруари DATE г. по адм. д. № DATE г. , PERSON , ORG ; реш. № CARDINAL от DATE г. по адм. д. № DATE г. , PERSON , V о. ; реш. № DATE от DATE г. по адм. д. № DATE г. , PERSON , V о. ; реш. № DATE от DATE г. по адм. д. № DATE г. , PERSON , V о. ; реш. № DATE от CARDINAL юли DATE г. по адм. д. № DATE г. , PERSON , V о. ; реш. № DATE от CARDINAL юли DATE г. по адм. д. № DATE г. , PERSON , V о. ; and реш. № DATE от CARDINAL юли DATE г. по адм. д. № DATE г. , PERSON , V о. ; and реш. № CARDINAL от CARDINAL март DATE г. по адм. д. № DATE г. , PERSON , ORG ) . In some of those cases the panels also held that , as far as it provided that the psychological assessment could determine whether the member of staff had abused his or her position for financial gain , Instruction no . PERSON ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) ran counter to the Act : mental fitness for work was not to be confused with the commission of disciplinary offences ( see реш. № DATE от DATE г. по адм. д. № DATE г. , ORG , V о. , and реш. № DATE от DATE г. по адм. д. № DATE г. , PERSON , V о. ) .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL)(CARDINAL ) of ORG ( “ the CARDINAL Act ” ) , which superseded LAW in DATE , provides that a civil servant employed by ORG must be dismissed on health grounds if he or she can not perform his or her duties as a result of a health condition which has led to a permanent disability or as a result of medical contraindications .
